title: B5084.pdf
content:
leeping during the day must be avoided.
Early winter (Nov.-Dec.)Intake of heavy, oily, sweet, sour, salty, hot food items, soups, honey, milk and milk products indicated. 
Light, dry & cold food, 
fasting or skipping meals best avoided.Oil massage, steam, oiling of head, sun bath, exercise, warm clothes is advised. Sleeping during the day must be avoided.
Late Winter (Jan.-Feb.)Sweet, sour, salty, oily, heavy and hot foods, soups, milk, rice, honey, ginger are indicated.  Excess pungent, bitter, astringent tastes, light, 
dry and cold foods 
avoidable.Use of woollen blankets and other measures for protection against cold such as warm clothing & warm homes is advised. Massage, steam, exercise are indicated. Morning walk in dew should be avoided or done with precaution. Sleeping 
during the day must be avoided.
•
Change of 
season has 
an effect on 
the physical, 
mental and 
the digestive 
strength of our 
bodies
